abstract.text: Learn about changes to the App Store Server Notifications service.

inlineContent.text: App Store Server Notifications has two versions of notifications. Version 1 notifications and the
endpoint are deprecated. Instead, implement the
endpoint on your server to receive version 2 notifications.
To set up your server to receive notifications, see
. Use this changelog to learn about feature updates, version information, deprecations, and removals for App Store Server Notifications.
Added support for the Advanced Commerce API.
Added the win-back offer type to
. This notification type is currently available only in the sandbox environment.
added notifications for refund requests for auto-renewable subscriptions.
to include the new payload object,
Changed the notification type the App Store server sends when a customer redeems a subscription offer for an inactive subscription to the
. The App Store server only sends the
notification type when customers redeem an offer on an active subscription.

field in the renewal info decoded payload,

In App Store Server Notifications 2, the notification subtype

is now sent when the App Store notifies the customer of an auto-renewable subscription price increase that doesn’t require customer consent. This notification subtype is available only in version 2 notifications. For more information, see
is available, and version 1 is still supported. For information about the notifications sent in version 2, see

App Store Server Notifications is available.

abstract.text: Monitor In-App Purchase events in real time and learn of unreported external purchase tokens, with server notifications from the App Store.
Specify your secure server’s URL in App Store Connect to receive version 1 notifications.
Specify your secure server’s URL in App Store Connect to receive version 2 notifications.
A decoded payload containing subscription renewal information for an auto-renewable subscription.
A decoded payload that contains transaction information.
Receive, parse, and interpret App Store Server Notifications version 1.
A UUID that associates the transaction with a customer on your service.
The unique identifier of the app download transaction.
The customer-provided reason for a refund request.
The three-letter ISO 4217 currency code for the price of the product.
The payload data that contains app metadata and the signed renewal and transaction information.
An array of win-back offer identifiers that a customer is eligible to redeem, which sorts the identifiers to present the better offers first.
Configure your server and provide an HTTPS URL to receive notifications about in-app purchase events and unreported external purchase tokens.
The field of an external purchase token that uniquely identifies the token.
The payload data that contains an external purchase token.
The type that describes the in-app purchase or external purchase event for which the App Store sends the version 2 notification.
The type that describes the in-app purchase event for which the App Store sends the version 1 notification.
The payment mode for a subscription offer for an auto-renewable subscription.
The duration of the offer.
The type of subscription offer.
The price, in milliunits, of the In-App Purchase that the system records in the transaction.
Implement server-side code to receive and parse notification posts.
Send HTTP status codes to indicate the success of a notification post.

doc://com.apple.appstoreservernotificati.title: Responding to App Store Server Notifications

abstract.text: The response body containing JSON data that the App Store sends in a version 1 server notification.
The response body the App Store sends in a version 2 server notification.
A decoded payload that contains the version 2 notification data.
The status of an auto-renewable subscription at the time the App Store signs the notification.
The three-letter code that represents the country or region associated with the App Store storefront for the purchase.
An Apple-defined value that uniquely identifies an App Store storefront.
A string that provides details about select notification types in version 2.
The payload data for a subscription-renewal-date extension notification.
The field of an external purchase token that contains the UNIX date, in milliseconds, when the system created the token.
The cause of a purchase transaction, which indicates whether it’s a customer’s purchase or a renewal for an auto-renewable subscription that the system initiates.
Manage your customers’ App Store transactions from your server.
Check the status of the test App Store server notification sent to your server.
Ask App Store Server Notifications to send a test notification to your server.
Uses a subscription’s product identifier to extend the renewal date for all of its eligible active subscribers.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Extend Subscription Renewal Dates for All Active Subscribers

abstract.text: The renewal price, in milliunits, of the auto-renewable subscription that renews at the next billing period.
